title: 📝 Blog and Professional Channels
text:
Welcome! Here you can find my professional writings, research updates, and project showcases across different platforms:

📰 Medium — Articles and insights on data science, AI, and technology.  🧑‍💻 GitHub — Code repositories, project demos, and practical implementations.  🎓 Google Scholar — Academic publications and research contributions.  🔗 LinkedIn — Connect and follow my professional updates. 
Thank you for your time!

title: Katie B
text:
Welcome to my profile! 





Hello, I’m Katie Baronowski  🎓 PhD Student in Information Science with a focus on integrating the technological with the original biological sensors, using drones and AI to enhance the work of detection dogs. 🏫 State University of New York at Albany (SUNY Albany) 📍 New York, USA 
🔬 Research Interests:
- Human-Computer Interaction
- Improving detection capabilities - Human and Animal Behavior and Cognition

title: Katie B
text:
Welcome to my profile! 





Hello, I’m Katie Baronowski  🎓 PhD Student in Information Science with a focus on integrating the technological with the original biological sensors, using drones and AI to enhance the work of detection dogs. 🏫 State University of New York at Albany (SUNY Albany) 📍 New York, USA 
🔬 Research Interests:
- Human-Computer Interaction
- Improving detection capabilities - Human and Animal Behavior and Cognition

title: Katie B
text:
Education
🎓 PhD Student in Information Science, State University of New York at Albany, USA (Aug 2024 – Present)  - Cumulative GPA: 4.00/4.00.  - Primary Specialization: Information for Risk in Emergency Management and Security - Secondary Specialization: Information in Organizational Environments
🎓 Bachlelor of Technology in Canine Training and Management and Bachelor of Science in Applied Psychology, SUNY Cobleskill, USA (Aug 2020 – May 2024)  - Outstanding Student in Psychology 2024.  - Student Leadership Award 2024.  - Honors Capstone: Canine discrimination of the enantiomers of carvone.

title: Katie B
text:
Research Overview
My research explores the intersection of Technological and the Biological, developing AI algorithms that enhance predication of target odor and the efficacy of search and rescue.

title: Katie B
text:
Recent Updates
🏆 Received AEOP Fellowship.  🚀 Internship at the Grants, Research, and Opportunites Workforce in the State University of New York system for summer 2025. 📜 Attending INTERSECT bootcamp at Princeton New Jersey (July 2025).  ✍️ First-author manuscript on detection dogs.  🚀 Mentoring undergraduate students in the Mobile Sensor Lab at SUNY Albany.

title: Katie B
text:
Quick Links
🔬 Research  🎓 Academic Experience  💼 Professional Experience  🛠️ Practical Projects  📝 Blog  📄 CV

title: 🔬 Research
text:
Information Science student, with a focus on human-computer interaction, information behavior, and utilizing technology to enhance detection K9-handler teams.

🛡️ My work explores: - 🔒 Detection dogs - 🔐 Information Behavior - 💧 Human-Computer Interaction
to improve detection capabilites and response during emergencies and disasters.

title: 🔬 Research
text:
📝 Forthcoming (Submitted)

Katie Baronowski, Thomas Sadekoski, Kathryn Miller, Brian Hefferon, Eric Best, Mark Cornwell, Jennifer Essler. Round Goby Detection Dogs

title: 🏫 Academic Experience
text:
🎓 Education


Ph.D. Student in Information Science Aug 2024 – Present 🏫 State University of New York at Albany, NY, USA 🔬 Research Topic: Trustworthy Machine Learning and AI through the Lens of Privacy and Security 📊 GPA: 4.00/4.00


Master in Analytics, Applied Machine Intelligence Aug 2021 – Jul 2023 🏫 Northeastern University, MA, USA 📝 Thesis: Improving Safety through the Integration of Multi-sensor Fusion and Deep Learning-based Object Detection 📊 GPA: 4.00/4.00




👨‍🏫 Teaching & Student Mentorship Experience


Intern Mentor – State University of New York at Albany Jan 2024 – Present 🤝 Mentored undergraduate interns on the project Transforming Large Language Model Alignment: Automating Reference Data Generation through Explainable AI.


Teaching Assistant – Northeastern University Aug 2021 – Dec 2021 📚 Course: ALY 6010 - Introduction to Statistics and Probability




🏆 Honors & Awards

🥈 Second Prize, Best Poster at NTIR 2025 Apr 2025  🎓 Valedictorian, Master in Analytics, Northeastern University Jul 2023  🏅 Hackathon Winner – OCR and Language Model for Form Autofill, Definity Financial Feb 2023  🎯 Top 20 Finalist – VinUniversity Global Case Competition Dec 2021  💰 Merit-based Scholarship, Foreign Trade University 2013 & 2014  🌟 Talent Incubation Scholarship, Coca-Cola Vietnam & Thanh Nien News Nov 2013  🌍 Ambassador – Exchange Participant, AIESEC Indonesia Jun–Aug 2013 



🤝 Professional Services

🎪 Organizer committee, NTIR Conference - Where Innovation Meets Information 2025 April 2025  📖 Journal Reviewer, Journal of Combinatorial Optimization 2025 Jan–May 2025  📝 Conference Reviewer, Computational Data and Social Networks 2024 Oct–Dec 2024

title: 💼 Professional Experience
text:
AEOP Fellowship (Remote) Jun 2025 – Sept 2025 🏢 US ARMY DEVCOM Chemical Biological Center, USA 📝 Develop innovative methods to improve the performance of detection dogs.


Summer Intern (Part-time) Jun 2025 – Aug 2025 🏢 State University of New York, NY, USA - 🤖 Developed framework for horizon scanning. - 🧠 Enhanced white papers with new research from the 64 SUNY campuses. - 📈 Built blog post communications pipeline.


Research Coordinator (Co-op) Jun 2025 – Aug 2025 🏢 State University of New York at Cobleskill, NY, USA - 🖼️ Coordinated Round Goby detection dog project with USGS. - 🚀 Collected samples, trained participants, ran expiremental trials.

title: 🚀 Practical Projects
text: This proof of principle project was designed to test the feasibility of round goby detection dogs, to identify of the invasion fronts in the tributaries of the Mohawk River in collaboration with USGS.
